description: Inverse of n under Nim (or Conway) multiplication.
comments: The Conway product makes N into a field of characteristic 2. This is the inverse function for that field.
references: E. R. Berlekamp, J. H. Conway and R. K. Guy, ``Winning Ways'', p. 443.
J. H. Conway, ``On Numbers and Games'', chapter 6.
links: Paul Tek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..255
David A. Madore, Notes on game theory
Index entries for sequences related to Nim-multiplication
example: a(4)=15 because the Conway product of 4 and 15 is 1. And a(15)=4.
author: _David A. Madore_, Dec 18 1999
extensions: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Mar 01 2001
